meaning: The point at which quantity demanded and quantities supplied are equal.
Where quantity demanded of a good or service exceeds supply, resulting in shortages and higher prices.
Where quantity supplied of a good or service exceeds supply, resulting in shortages and higher prices.
A movement along the demand curve to the right (lower price & higher quantity demanded).
A movement along the supply curve to the right (higher price & higher quantity supplied).
Price at which the amount supplied matches the exact amount demanded.
